markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub!

To show shadow of mui typography in React js, you can use this code sx={{ textShadow: '2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25), -2px -2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)' }}. It will show shadow of mui typography in react js.

Today, I am going to show you, how to show shadow of mui typography in react js.

Installation

Install the following packages to use mui typography in react js.

npm

npm install @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

yarn

yarn add @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

Table of contents

  • Install MUI and create a new React app.
  • Import Material-UI Typography.
  • Show shadow of mui typography Component.

Step 1: Install MUI and create a new React app.

First you have to install the React project. You should use create-react-app command to create a new React project.

npx create-react-app my-app
cd my-app
npm start

Step 2: Import Material-UI Typography.

After installing MUI, you have to import your React component. To do this, add the following line to the top of your component file.

import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography';

Step 3: Show shadow of mui typography Component.

You can use the Typography component in your react js. For example, The typography component is used to create text. and textShadow CSS property set to '2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25), -2px -2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)'.

<Typography variant="h2" sx={{ textShadow: '2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25), -2px -2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)' }}>
    This is a text with custom shadow.
</Typography>

MUI material show shadow of mui typography example.

The code below is an example of showing shadow of mui typography, setting the textShadow to '2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25), -2px -2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)' will show text shadow of mui typography.

App.js

import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography';

export default function App() {
  return (
   
    <Typography variant="h2" sx={{ textShadow: '2px 2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25), -2px -2px 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)' }}>
    This is a text with custom shadow.
    </Typography>
  );
}

In the above code example, I have used the @mui/material component and show shadow of mui typography in react js.

Check the output of the above code example.

Here, we are provided code sandbox links for the above program show shadow of mui typography in react js. Then you can use whenever you want and do the changes as per your requirements.

Try it Yourself

All the best üëç
